events.description: The Bank of England is expected to announce its policy decision.

facts.fact_text: UK 10-year gilt yields climbed to 4.6%, their highest level since mid-October

evidences.evidence_text: UK 10-year gilt yields climbed to 4.6%, their highest level since mid-October

facts.fact_text: The spread between two- and 10-year gilts widened to its largest since 2018

evidences.evidence_text: The spread between two- and 10-year gilts widened to its largest since 2018

facts.fact_text: The Bank of England is widely expected to leave the benchmark interest rate unchanged at 3.75%

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, the Bank of England is widely expected to leave the benchmark interest rate unchanged at 3.75%

UK 10-year gilt yields climbed to 4.6%, their highest level since mid-October, as renewed political uncertainty pressured longer-dated debt ahead of the Bank of England’s policy announcement later today.

claims.claim_text: Uncertainty remains around the timing, pace, and ultimate extent of any easing cycle.

evidences.evidence_text: While policymakers continue to signal that the next move in rates is likely downward, uncertainty remains around the timing, pace, and ultimate extent of any easing cycle.

evidence.evidence_text: UK 10-year gilt yields climbed to 4.6%, their highest level since mid-October, as renewed political uncertainty pressured longer-dated debt ahead of the Bank of England’s policy announcement later today.

UK 10-year gilt yields climbed to 4.6%, their highest level since mid-October, as renewed political uncertainty pressured longer-dated debt ahead of the Bank of England’s policy announcement later today.
The spread between two- and 10-year gilts widened to its largest since 2018, highlighting growing term premia and investor unease.

Meanwhile, the Bank of England is widely expected to leave the benchmark interest rate unchanged at 3.75%, with markets focused on the minutes, forward guidance, and the inflation and labor market outlook.
